column4: Sorry it was on. I turned it off from the router. And am now restarting it. Ok finally it stops working!
struggling with semantics :)
You know/
What is the place where network-admin stores all my 'locations' data?
I don't know that, sorry
the main config file is /etc/network/interfaces - possibly the other info is stored in a dot file (in  .gnome2/ or something - but as I said, I don't actually know that
OK i keyed in my network info in the network-admin. Now when i ping my router it says Network is unreachable.
there?
I have to turn off firestarter now to browse.
well, that's a firewall config issue,. right ?
It has_now_become a firewall config issue
Before the whole network-manager uninstall thing it didn't happen. What should I do?
think?  You probably need to look at your firestarter settings, yes ?
Yes.
can you help?
Thought you do understand that re-configuring the network has made it a firewall config issue don't you?
just ask the channel - there are currently 1370 othher people here you know
sorry.
I can't solve all your problems :)
hint: check outgoing permissions on port 80 in firestarter
If only I knew how.
open firestarter, click the help button. Alternatively, visit the firestarter home page
I would better feed myself first. Thank you :)
